e4: Adopting the new policy aligns with ethical business practices by eliminating bias in reported earnings, fostering transparency, and reducing the risk of legal liabilities. Although some investors may initially misinterpret the change, consistent and clear communication can help transition them to understanding the new policy. This shift enhances long-term trust and integrity with all investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should provide accurate, clear, and unbiased financial information, ensuring transparency and fostering trust among all stakeholders. It must comply with legal standards and promote equal access to information, preventing any advantage to more informed parties. Furthermore, such a policy should involve regular, honest communication to maintain investor confidence and reflect the company’s commitment to integrity and accountability.
e6: Yes, I would ask how management plans to communicate the change in policy effectively to all investors to ensure understanding, and what strategies are in place to mitigate any potential short-term market disruptions or misunderstandings once the new policy is implemented.
